intro: Calathea annae, commonly known as the velvet leaf calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety, dark green leaves with intricate patterns of silver and pink. The plant belongs to the Marantaceae family and is prized for its ornamental value in indoor gardening. Calathea annae thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. Its foliage changes color subtly in response to light exposure, making it a fascinating subject for plant enthusiasts.
